thread.title: Growth Partners, in Colton Square, Leicester, becomes latest patron of East Midlands Chamber - Leicestershire Live

author: Tom Pegden
title: Growth Partners, in Colton Square, Leicester, becomes latest patron of East Midlands Chamber - Leicestershire Live

organizations.name: east midlands chamber share get business

text:
Growth Partners, in Colton Square, Leicester, becomes latest patron of East Midlands Chamber Leicester firm gives SMEs access to the same benefits and services that help bigger businesses prosper Share Scott Knowles, chief executive of East Midlands Chamber Share Get Business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A Leicester business that helps SMEs grow by granting them access to the same benefits and services that help bigger businesses prosper has become the latest patron of East Midlands Chamber .
Growth Partners, in Colton Square, Leicester , has joined the list of companies that want to take an influential and prominent role in the local business community and share the values that drive the chamber forward.
The offers its clients practical employee support ranging from an online GP to emotional counselling and a discounts scheme to help employers boost their staff wellbeing, morale and engagement levels.
It also handles HR and administrative duties for employers such as payroll, pensions and employment law.
Chamber chief executive Scott Knowles said: “I am delighted to welcome Growth Partners into patronage.
“Chamber patrons are a powerful force in influencing policy, driving economic growth and development and equipping smaller businesses with the knowledge and skills that are vital to their future.” Read More East Midlands Chamber warns Brexit "could be" hitting Leicestershire business confidence
Paul Bresnihan, CEO at Growth Partners, said: “It’s an exciting time for our particular industry, and we’re very much looking forward to the opportunity to support and develop what we know to be a fantastic network of East Midlands enterprises.”
The chamber has 27 patrons, including Nottingham Forest Football Club, PKF Cooper Parry, QDOS, The Money Shop, Toyota Manufacturing UK, Westfield Health and Wilko. Like us on Facebook
